newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka gains in a dull market.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka gains in a dull market.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed firmer at 42.5460/5490 to the dollar in a low-key interbank session against the previous close of 42.5485/5495, dealers said.
The local unit was quoted mostly steady at 42.5480/5495 in early trade but gained later on poor dollar demand.

"Saturday is usually a dull day due to weekend closure of international markets. Also most banks are now suddenly enjoying healthy liquidity (of the dollar) because of some recent inflow of wage earners' remittance," said one dealer.
The interbank call money rates ended unchanged at 4.5 percent to 5.5 percent in a liquid maket, dealers said.
